sru:extraResponseData.fcs:transformedQuery: SELECT ndx.txt, base.entry, base.sid, COUNT(*) FROM vicav_lingfeatures_001 AS base INNER JOIN vicav_lingfeatures_001_ndx AS ndx ON base.id = ndx.id WHERE (ndx.xpath LIKE '%TEI-text-body-div-head-') AND ndx.txt LIKE '%Linguistic%' GROUP BY base.sid

fcs:ResourceFragment.fcs:DataView: A machine-readable list of linguistic features of Arabic dialects

sourceDesc.p: This is an original digital text

div.head: Linguistic Features (Cairo)
div.p: Criteria catalogues to be used in comparative studies appear to be a most natural thing, nevertheless, nothing of the kind has been provided in form of a proposal to standardize digital processing so far. The following tentative list of distinctive linguistic features is meant to serve as a basis for discussion. The draft is designed in an extensible manner, open for any amendments/refinements and enhancements.

div.head: Interrogatives

row.cell: Most commonly dialects show reflexes of CA man .

cit.quote: mīn iṛ-ṛāgil da ? – da ṣaḥbi . (huwwa ṣaḥbi)
Who is this man? – He is my friend
di ʕaṛabiyyit mīn ? – di l-ʕaṛabiyya btaʕitna. (hiyya) ṣġayyara bassᴵ kwayyisa.
Whose car is this? – This is our car. It’s small but it’s good.

fs.f: Demonstr. f., Stat. constr. fem. Suffix 1Pl., gut, klein, aber

cit.quote: bitiʕmili ʔēh dilwaʔti , yā faṭma? – batfaṛṛag ʕa-t-tilifizyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Fatima, was tust du gerade? – Ich sehe fern.
ma-gā-š lēh ? – ma-baʕṛaf-š.
Why didn’t he come? – I don’t know.

row.cell: A very common pattern are reflexes of CA fī + ’ayna

cit.quote: fēn il-mubayl bitāʕi ? – ʔahó !
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
rāyiḥ/rayḥa ( ʕala ) fēn? – ʕa -l- bēt .
Where are you (m./f.) going? – I am going home.
ʔinta/ʔinti/ʔintu mnēn ? – ʔana/ʔiḥna min maṣr.
Where are you (m./f.; sg./pl.) from? – I am/ We are from Cairo.
ya-faṭma, ʔimta šufti mḥammad? – šuftu mbāriḥ.
Fatima, when did you see Muhammad? – I saw him yesterday.
ʔizzayyak? – kwayyis , (il-ḥamdu li-llāh). / ʔizzayyik? – kuwayyisa , (l-ḥamdu li-llāh).
How are you (m./f.)? – I’m fine.
Wie geht es dir (m./f.)? – Mir geht es gut.
nuṣṣᴵ kīlu lamūn b-kām ? – bi-ʕašra (ginēh).
How much is half a kilo of lemons? – It’s 10 (Pounds).
ʕandak kām walad? – ʕandi bintēn w-talat wilād.
How many children do you (f.) have? – I have two daughters and three sons.

fs.f: Kinder, Interd., Dual, haben, Tochter, Sohn, 3

cit.quote: saknīn fi manṭiʔit ēh ? – iḥna saknīn fi z-zamālik.
In which neighbourhood do you live? – We live in Zamalik.

div.head: Demonstratives

cit.quote: mīn iṛ-ṛāgil da ? – da ṣaḥbi . (huwwa ṣaḥbi)
Who is this man? – He is my friend

div.head: Pronouns
Adverbs

cit.quote: baʔa-lna hina taman sanawāt .
We have been here for 8 years.
bitiʕmili ʔēh dilwaʔti , yā faṭma? – batfaṛṛag ʕa-t-tilifizyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Fatima, was tust du gerade? – Ich sehe fern.
ʔid-dinya ḥarrᴵ ʔawi in-nahaṛ-da .
It’s very hot today.
ʔid-dinya kānit bitmaṭṭaṛ imbāriḥ .
Yesterday it rained.
Gestern hat es geregnet.
ya-wlād, bukṛa lāzim tidrisu.
Hey kids, tomorrow you have to study.
ʔis-sana lli fātit kān ʕandina mašākil kitīr.
Last year we had many problems.

div.head: Numerals

cit.quote: baʔa-lna hina taman sanawāt .
We have been here for 8 years.
fi faṣlina fīh tamantāšar ṭālib gidīd.
There are 18 new students in our class.

div.head: Adjectives

cit.quote: ʔizzayyak? – kwayyis , (il-ḥamdu li-llāh). / ʔizzayyik? – kuwayyisa , (l-ḥamdu li-llāh).
How are you (m./f.)? – I’m fine.
Wie geht es dir (m./f.)? – Mir geht es gut.

div.head: Prepositions

cit.quote: fi faṣlina fīh tamantāšar ṭālib gidīd.
There are 18 new students in our class.

div.head: Important verbs
div.p: The following list contains a list very frequent verbs.

cit.quote: bitiʕmili ʔēh dilwaʔti , yā faṭma? – batfaṛṛag ʕa-t-tilifizyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Fatima, was tust du gerade? – Ich sehe fern.
xallīk šwayya! – laʔ, ma-ʕandī-š waʔt.
Stay a bit longer! – No, I don’t have time.
Bleib noch ein bisschen da! - Nein, ich habe keine Zeit.

fs.f: bleiben, ein bißchen, nein, nicht haben.

cit.quote: bititkallim ʕaṛabi? – šwayya bass.
Do you speak Arabic? – Just, a little.
ʔid-dinya kānit bitmaṭṭaṛ imbāriḥ .
Yesterday it rained.
Gestern hat es geregnet.
ʔiftaḥ iš-šibbāk!
Open the window!
Mach das Fenster auf!
ʔiʔfil l-abwāb!
Close the doors!
Mach die Türen zu!
xadtᴵ ʔēh? – maxaditšᴵ wala ḥāga.
What did you take? – Nothing.
ʕiddēt il-gawāb li-ʔaḥmad? – ʔaywa, ʔiddit-ū-lu.
Did you give the letter to Ahmad? – Yes, I gave it to him.
l-awlād šāfu šaḥḥāt waṛa l-bēt bitaʕna.
The children saw a beggar behind our house.
ʕawza tišrabi šāy walla ʔahwa? – šāy, law samaḥt.
Do you (f.) want to drink tea or coffee? – Tea please.

div.head: Phrasemes

row.cell: Many Arabic dialects use periphrastic constructions to render English ‛since’.

cit.quote: baʔa-lna hina taman sanawāt .
We have been here for 8 years.

div.head: Nouns

cit.quote: biyiʕmilu ʔēh is-sittāt dōl? – biyixbizu.
What are those women doing there? – They are baking bread.
gōzi lābis ʔamīṣ ʔabyaḍ . ʕandina ʕaṛabiyya bēḍa .
My husband wears a white shirt. We have a white car.
mīn iṛ-ṛāgil da ? – da ṣaḥbi . (huwwa ṣaḥbi)
Who is this man? – He is my friend

div.head: Neologisms

cit.quote: fēn il-mubayl bitāʕi ? – ʔahó !
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!

div.head: Modality

cit.quote: ma-niʔdaṛ-šᴵ nidfaʕ il-ʔugṛa.
We cannot pay the rent.

div.head: Other items

cit.quote: bititkallim ʕaṛabi? – šwayya bass.
Do you speak Arabic? – Just, a little.
fi faṣlina fīh tamantāšar ṭālib gidīd.
There are 18 new students in our class.
fēn il-mubayl bitāʕi ? – ʔahó !
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!

fcs:ResourceFragment.fcs:DataView: A machine-readable list of linguistic features of Arabic dialects

div.head: Linguistic Features: Damascus
div.p: Criteria catalogues to be used in comparative studies appear to be a most natural thing, nevertheless, nothing of the kind has been provided in form of a proposal to standardize digital processing so far. The following tentative list of distinctive linguistic features is meant to serve as a basis for discussion. The draft is designed in an extensible manner, open for any amendments/refinements and enhancements.

div.head: Interrogatives

row.cell: Most commonly dialects show reflexes of CA man .

cit.quote: mīn hāda z-zalame? – hāda rfīʔi. (huwwe rfīʔi)
Who is this man? – He is my friend
¿Quién es este hombre? - Es mi amigo.

fs.f: Demonst m., Mann, Freund, Pron 3mSg, Suffix 1Sg, who

cit.quote: šū ʕam- ᵊtsāwi hallaʔ yā Fāṭme. – ʕam-ᵊtfarraž ʕa-t-tǝlfǝzyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Was machst du gerade, Fatima? - Ich schaue fern.
Fátima, ¿qué estás haciendo ahora? - Estoy viendo la televisión.

fs.f: machen, jetzt, Genusdist, akt. Präsens, what

row.cell: A very common pattern are reflexes of CA fī + ’ayna

div.head: Demonstratives
Pronouns
Adverbs

cit.quote: šū ʕam- ᵊtsāwi hallaʔ yā Fāṭme. – ʕam-ᵊtfarraž ʕa-t-tǝlfǝzyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Was machst du gerade, Fatima? - Ich schaue fern.
Fátima, ¿qué estás haciendo ahora? - Estoy viendo la televisión.

fs.f: machen, jetzt, Genusdist, akt. Präsens, what

Important verbs
div.p: The following list contains a list very frequent verbs.

cit.quote: šū ʕam- ᵊtsāwi hallaʔ yā Fāṭme. – ʕam-ᵊtfarraž ʕa-t-tǝlfǝzyōn.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV.
Was machst du gerade, Fatima? - Ich schaue fern.
Fátima, ¿qué estás haciendo ahora? - Estoy viendo la televisión.

fs.f: machen, jetzt, Genusdist, akt. Präsens, what

cit.quote: bǝddek tǝšrabi šāy walla ʔahwe ? – šāy, ʔǝza bǝtrīd.
Do you (f.) want to drink tea or coffee? – Tea please.
¿Quieres (f.) beber té o café? - Té, por favor.

div.head: Phrasemes

row.cell: Many Arabic dialects use periphrastic constructions to render English ‛since’.
